reviewText: I've been watching a lot of Action/Adventure movies lately, especially the offerings of Chuck Norris, and I've really enjoyed them. Last night it was time for a bit of a change, so I put on the "Bounty Hunters" movie starring Michael Dudikoff and Lisa Howard. I was disappointed. Very disappointed. The drop from Chuck Norris movies to this level was just too great. Gosh, where can I start? Well, the acting was awful. And it went all the way from the major stars right down to a kid in the movie. What is this? Am I missing something? Is the uniformity of bad acting some kind of artsy humor? Well, I became fatigued by it early on and it didn't get any better as the movie progressed. The story was equally weak and seemed contrived just to move from one action scene to the next. Michael Dudikoff (Jersey) plays a bounty hunter and Lisa Howard (BB) plays a rival bounty hunter. Both are fairly accomplished martial artists so we have a lot of fairly accomplished martial arts battles as a part of the action. They don't get up to the level of Chuck Norris fights, I might add. Lisa is not all that convincing in that she's just too light in stature to be tossing the big guys around in the way she does, but it's fun to watch her. Well, no matter. Nothing else about the movie is too convincing either so it all fits. Jersey is Dudikoff's movie name and I suppose the origin is obvious. BB is Lisa's name and it stands for a euphemism applied to gonad crushing.So, Jersey and BB go through this contrived story involving the mob. One of the mob kills another gangster and, unfortunately, there's a witness and, of course, this witness has to be eliminated. The story involves the hiding of the witness, the finding of the witness, the freeing of the witness by Jersey and BB and everything ending somewhat happily with Jersey and BB becoming rough pals. Yaawwwnnnn!!! You know, I got this movie on a compilation DVD featuring "8 Action Movies" and there is actually a second "Bounty Hunters 2" movie on the same disc. Well, I can't believe a movie as bad as "Bounty Hunters" would give rise to a "Bounty Hunters 2." Again, I must be out of the loop and missing something here. Will I be watching "Bounty Hunters 2"? In a word, No.Gary Peterson
Title: Bounty Hunters

reviewText: Michael Dudikoff deserves credit: even though he's received a good deal of criticism as being a disappointing action hero impersonator, his rate of output in the low budget adventure genre was impressive, and every once in a while he'd manage a genuinely entertaining production like "Bounty Hunters" here. As you can tell by the rating, it's not entertaining in a perfect way, but nonetheless makes for fun viewing on a slow afternoon.The story: professional bounty hunters Jersey (Dudikoff) and B. B. (Lisa Howard,Earth: Final Conflict) form an uneasy partnership of necessity when the criminal they are both hunting gets them in the crosshairs of the mafia...If you, like me, know Dudikoff mainly from his outings as theAmerican Ninja, you may be surprised to see how he emotes as the easy-going, wise-cracking hero of the film; regardless of whether he does it well or poorly, Michael Dudikoff certainly *can* act. Then again, few performers here have problems with being expressive: supporting villain Freddy Andreiuci (Witchcraft V) and prostitute/voice actress Erin Fitzgerald (Sabrina the Teenage Witch) are virtual cartoon characters, and main bad guy Benjamin Ratner (Last Wedding) is unrestrainedly cheesy in his depiction of the Latin mob boss. The proliferation of these slightly-overacting characters made me realize that this is actually an action-comedy, though so effectively camouflaged in the package of a regular mid-90s action flick that it's a bit unclear which parts are purposely meant to be funny. It's not a total triumph, but the movie walks the line between adrenaline and buffoonery more skillfully than many others of its kind.While flawed, the action content is more than sufficient for the movie. There's some shooting, some fast cars, and a small proliferation of attack traps (car hood projectiles, electrocuted lamp, exploding television...), but naturally, what caught my eye most were the six fight scenes that Dudikoff shares with Lisa Howard. Ol' Michael has found a way to make his own awkward karate look good: by having a co-star whose moves are even more awkward. I like Lisa as a character, but man! - even though she's a legitimate martial artist, her goofy kicking would have Cynthia Rothrock shaking her head in shame. None of the fights are particularly noteworthy, though the best of them - a six-on-two encounter in a chop shop - features some cool spin kicks on the parts of the henchmen.There's not much that can be changed about "Bounty Hunters" to make it better without changing its formula. It's surprisingly fun in some respects, but these are the same reason that the movie's audience base is limited. Dudikoff fans ought to snatch this one up quickly, and general action fans may enjoy it too, but that's where things stop.
summary: "You've got spirit, muchacho. I like that"

reviewText: Poorly acted and poor script.  The action scenes were some of the worst I have seen, looked completely faked.  Very disappointed.  I would never watch it again and will sell it in a garage sale.

reviewText: This movie is so funny. Michael Dudikoff  and this female are bounty hunters. The two of them are so funny together. They go after the same people and get into all sorts of trouble. They both do kung fu movies and she does a lot on him. He has his house rigged and trigger to go off if someone tries to brake in. It shows him at his house trying to get it to go off and it does. It go all over him. Then there is this kid that like hanging around him which he teaches him all sorts of things. There is some nudity in it. So this is not a movie for kids to watch.
